Browser (via CDN)

Copy-paste ready code for real-time progress and solutions:

üí° Note: The helper automatically detects CDN usage and handles CORS issues with Worker loading. Just include the script from CDN and use normally!

‚ö†Ô∏è Development: If testing latest changes from @main, add cache busting:
<script src="...solver-helper.js?v=YOUR_TIMESTAMP"></script>
Or use a versioned release tag: @v1.0.0 instead of @main 

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
  <meta charset="UTF-8">
  <title>Streaming Solver</title>
</head>
<body>
  <h1>2x2 Solver - Streaming Output</h1>
  <button onclick="streamingSolve()">Solve with Progress</button>
  <div id="output"></div>

  <script src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/or18/RubiksSolverDemo@main/dist/src/2x2solver/solver-helper.js"></script>
  <script>
    const helper = new Solver2x2Helper();
    
    async function streamingSolve() {
      const output = document.getElementById('output');
      output.innerHTML = '';
      
      // Initialize once
      await helper.init();
      
      // Solve with real-time progress
      const solutions = await helper.solve("R U R' U' R' F R2 U' R' U", {
        maxSolutions: 10,
        maxLength: 15,
        onProgress: (depth) => {
          output.innerHTML += `üîç Depth: ${depth}<br>`;
        }
      });
      
      // Display results
      output.innerHTML += `<br>‚úÖ Found ${solutions.length} solutions:<br>`;
      solutions.forEach((sol, i) => {
        output.innerHTML += `${i+1}. ${sol}<br>`;
      });
    }
  </script>
</body>
</html>

Node.js

Real-time solution streaming with callback:

const { Solver2x2HelperNode } = require('./solver-helper-node.js');

async function streamingSolve() {
  const helper = new Solver2x2HelperNode();
  
  // Initialize solver
  await helper.init();
  console.log('‚úÖ Solver ready!\n');
  
  // Solve with real-time callbacks
  const solutions = await helper.solve("R U R' U' R' F R2 U' R' U", {
    maxSolutions: 10,
    maxLength: 15,
    onProgress: (depth) => {
      // Real-time depth progress
      console.log(`üîç Searching depth: ${depth}`);
    },
    onSolution: (solution) => {
      // Real-time solution output (as found!)
      console.log(`‚úÖ Solution: ${solution}`);
    }
  });
  
  console.log(`\nüìä Total: ${solutions.length} solutions found`);
}

streamingSolve().catch(console.error);

üí° Tip: Use onProgress for depth updates and onSolution (Node.js only) for true streaming output as each solution is found during the search.
